title: Gargoyle's Stoneplate Conqueror
body: Does anyone know how this works, as in does the damage reduction from Stoneplate activate first, then the true damage is reduced as it is going off of the reduced damage beforehand, or the true damage isn't reduced but the ad damage is reduced?

replies.body:
when something deals true damage, if it specifies the amount of true damage, i.e. this ability does 100 true damage, then no matter what, it will do 100 damage regardless of anything.
However, when it says this attack does % of damage as true damage, the damage can be reduced by things like armour, MR and damage reduction.

So damage reduction first then true damage calculation.
I think the only exception to the "no matter what" are any abilities that grant invulnerability: Kayle's ult, Taric's ult, and Kindred's ult.

actually I did the tests and gargoyle does not reduce the true damage from conqueror, and in some occasions your aa will do more damage when you activate gargoyle (if the enemy  has lots of armour and you have titanic)
